items.content_html:
Welcome to 365pixels 👋🏻 Home for my 365 photo challenge, where I attempt to take and post a photo every day for one year.

Click on “Photos” above to see all the photos on one page or scroll around. You can find more pictures and some not-very-good blogging at cliff538.com

I hope the pictures bring a smile to your face or provide some inspiration for you to take your own.

Thank you for stopping by.
items.content_text:
Welcome to 365pixels 👋🏻 Home for my 365 photo challenge, where I attempt to take and post a photo every day for one year.  

Click on "Photos" above to see all the photos on one page or scroll around. You can find more pictures and some _not-very-good_ blogging at [cliff538.com](https://cliff538.com)

I hope the pictures bring a smile to your face or provide some inspiration for you to take your own. 

Thank you for stopping by.

items.content_html:
My M*A*S*H Dreams Come True (156/365)

One from the archives today. Selfie from many years ago, working on my commercial and instrument rotorcraft ratings in Ardmore, OK. All the Vietnam era vets who I flew with told me the best helicopter to learn in was the Bell 47. Even back then, not many places taught in the Bell 47. Thank goodness for Versatile Helicopters in Ardmore. I’ll never forget the time spent there.

#365in2025

https://365pixels.xyz
items.content_text: My M\*A\*S\*H Dreams Come True (156/365) One from the archives today. Selfie from many years ago, working on my commercial and instrument rotorcraft ratings in Ardmore, OK. All the Vietnam era vets who I flew with told me the best helicopter to learn in was the Bell 47. Even back then, not many places taught in the Bell 47. Thank goodness for Versatile Helicopters in Ardmore. I’ll never forget the time spent there. #365in2025 https://365pixels.xyz

End of a Long, Hot, Mostly On time day (142.5/365)

Hear me Bugle (119/365)

One from the archives today. Lots of errands today and office cleaning so no pictures today. This was from Rocky Mountain National Park a few years ago. I sat with the herd most of the day in the rain (comfortably in my car, of course) and thoroughly enjoyed watching them and filling up data cards.

items.content_html:
Dogs of Mastodon (108/365)

It was a day of firsts for both our furry friends as they bravely stepped onto stand-up paddleboards (SUPs). While River, the water-loving Golden, was his usual fearless self, Daisy, the Rhodesian Ridgeback, showed a courage we hadn’t seen before, considering her healthy aversion to water.

Both dogs surprised us with their adaptability. Daisy, in particular, showed remarkable resilience. She even outperformed River on the board, falling off just once but quickly getting back on. After that, she seemed to understand the risk and avoided any further mishaps.

Much more paddle boarding this Summer now!

#365in2025 #dogsofmastodon
items.content_text: Dogs of Mastodon (108/365) It was a day of firsts for both our furry friends as they bravely stepped onto stand-up paddleboards (SUPs). While River, the water-loving Golden, was his usual fearless self, Daisy, the Rhodesian Ridgeback, showed a courage we hadn't seen before, considering her healthy aversion to water. Both dogs surprised us with their adaptability. Daisy, in particular, showed remarkable resilience. She even outperformed River on the board, falling off just once but quickly getting back on. After that, she seemed to understand the risk and avoided any further mishaps. Much more paddle boarding this Summer now! #365in2025 #dogsofmastodon

items.content_html:
Into The Forest (92/365)

The Peace of Wild Things
by Wendell Berry

When despair for the world grows in me
and I wake in the night at the least sound
in fear of what my life and my children’s lives may be,
I go and lie down where the wood drake
rests in his beauty on the water, and the great heron feeds.
I come into the peace of wild things
who do not tax their lives with forethought
of grief. I come into the presence of still water.
And I feel above me the day-blind stars
waiting with their light. For a time
I rest in the grace of the world, and am free.
items.content_text: Into The Forest (92/365) > **The Peace of Wild Things** > *by Wendell Berry* > > When despair for the world grows in me > and I wake in the night at the least sound > in fear of what my life and my children's lives may be, > I go and lie down where the wood drake > rests in his beauty on the water, and the great heron feeds. > I come into the peace of wild things > who do not tax their lives with forethought > of grief. I come into the presence of still water. > And I feel above me the day-blind stars > waiting with their light. For a time > I rest in the grace of the world, and am free.

items.content_html:
Old School (90/365)

#365in2025

365Pixels

Round dials, baby…. from the archives today. This was the last flight for this bird, flew it to the bone-yard to be parted out and chopped up. I always feel sad about this process. This aircraft has moved hundreds of thousands of people all over the country safely and mostly on time. It was an honor to have flown its last flight.
items.content_text: Old School (90/365) #365in2025 [365Pixels](https://365pixels.xyz) Round dials, baby.... from the archives today. This was the last flight for this bird, flew it to the bone-yard to be parted out and chopped up. I always feel sad about this process. This aircraft has moved hundreds of thousands of people all over the country safely and _mostly_ on time. It was an honor to have flown its last flight.

items.content_html:
A Man And His Dog (45/365)

#365in2025

One from the archives today. The only shot you would have gotten today was of a pile of used Kleenex ; ) The big trip out was to the doctor for the good news that it’s only a lower respiratory infection. Two antibiotics and cough syrup to go please!

I love this shot. You can just see the bond between them, complete trust. The dog knew what to do and what to expect. It wasn’t his first land yacht rodeo.

You can go here for the rest of the shots in this series.
items.content_text: A Man And His Dog (45/365) #365in2025 One from the archives today. The only shot you would have gotten today was of a pile of used Kleenex ; ) The big trip out was to the doctor for the good news that it's only a lower respiratory infection. Two antibiotics and cough syrup to go please! I love this shot. You can just see the bond between them, complete trust. The dog knew what to do and what to expect. It wasn't his first land yacht rodeo. You can go [here](https://cliff538.com/land-yachts/) for the rest of the shots in this series.

items.content_html:
Rainy Day (16/365)

#365in2025

Posted at 365Pixels
You can see the other daily shots I had to choose from here. Would you have chosen a different one?

Pixels Note: Today’s shot was inspired by @maique@social.lol, who posted some rainy windshield shots that are always good in black and white. I was on a DeadHead from BNA, and luckily enough, it was raining, so I could get this shot. I liked the negative space around the window frame, making it somewhat unique. I was really torn on today’s pick. It could have gone several ways today; there was no clear winner for me today. But nonetheless, one has to be chosen!
items.content_text:

I was on a DeadHead from BNA, and luckily enough, it was raining, so I could get this shot. I liked the negative space around the window frame, making it somewhat unique.
